content.question: If an economy experiences an improvement in technology, what will happen to its production possibilities curve <math alttext="open parenthesis, P P C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(PPC)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and its long-run aggregate supply <math alttext="open parenthesis, L R A S, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(LRAS)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve?

choices.label: The <math alttext="P P C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PPC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> shifts inward, and the <math alttext="L R A S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRAS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve stays the same.

The <math alttext="P P C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PPC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> shifts outward, and the <math alttext="L R A S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRAS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve shifts inward.

The <math alttext="P P C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PPC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> stays the same, and the <math alttext="L R A S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>LRAS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curve shifts outward.
